##The isolated diary of three Wuhan Residents | story FM

Story

Features, welcome to the story FM. Here, we tell your story with your voice. Every Monday, Wednesday and Friday, all platforms are updated simultaneously.

Click on the picture above to jump to the "story FM" applet and listen to the real person. Remember to add "my little program" , one-click to listen to the whole story Yo!

FM story a few days ago to interview the Wuhan People, are currently in Wuhan Wuhan people. But we know that people from Wuhan, even from Hubei Province, now scattered across the country, are actively or passively accepting some kind of quarantine arrangement.

How are they doing in quarantine? How are you? What was the experience like?

Today, let's hear their stories.

Punch, school in Wuhan

After returning home in a city in Hebei designated hotel isolation

I am Punch, studying in Wuhan, and today is February 1,2020, the 12th day of my return home and the 3rd day of my quarantine at a designated hotel in a city in Hebei Province.

Since returning home on the 21st, my temperature has been at normal levels and I have shown no other symptoms, but I am still not allowed to isolate myself at home.

Everything was fine from the time I got home to the fifth day. It's just that the neighborhood committee called to ask me my temperature on the third day of the second lunar month. I haven't had a phone since eighth grade. On the fifth day, at 9:00 in the morning, my mom got a call saying she wanted to put me in isolation. My mother at that time asked, no symptoms can choose home isolation. They said to ask the superior again.

More than 4:00 pm, another staff member of the neighborhood committee called to say, can be isolated at home. We were just relieved that we were okay. As a result, at 9:00 p.m. , another call came in, from the man in the morning, who said that the current request had to be quarantined at the hotel, and it wasn't just me, my mother had to be quarantined together because of my contact, and had to be there by 12:00 p.m, or the police will step in.

As soon as it sounded so serious, and we were very cooperative, we started packing up. And then at 10:00, she calls me up and says, "my mom won't take it, just me, no explanation. ".

â–  Punch filmed what he saw out of his hotel room between Jan. 30 and Feb. 2 in isolation

I have no symptoms, the heart is reluctant to go, because it is equivalent to all the history of Wuhan stay together, in case there is a carrier, I feel very dangerous. But at the time, he said it was an emergency late-night meeting in the city, and it felt like there was a policy. And I did come back from Wuhan. Besides, if we don't go, the police won't be necessary.

I had actually been mentally preparing for my isolation this morning, thinking ahead about what I wanted to bring. In addition to a change of clothes, I also brought some masks, alcohol, alcohol cotton, small watering can. Actually, I was afraid. I know it's been said over and over again, but I wanted to bring more of these.

I don't have a car. I have an electric car. It's pretty cold up north around 10:00 at night, but we're in a bit of a rush here, so we won't have time to arrange a car. My mom used to take me there on her scooter.

My mom wasn't well. It was after 11:00. She'll be home by 12:00. When I facetimed her, she didn't look so good, and when I asked her what was wrong, she said she had a toothache. I know she didn't sleep well that night. Later we chatted and learned that she would not fall asleep until after 4 am.

The central quarantine was a local hotel my mother had owned when she was young, and it was quite old.

When we arrived that night, the front door of the hotel had been sealed off, and the only way up was through one of the old outdoor stairs on the side. There was a nurse there checking in, and she asked me if I had a quarantine notice, and I didn't. She said she'd patch it up later, but I haven't seen it yet.

It's quite a hotel. I'm on the sixth floor. I heard the delivery guy downstairs yelling that his kid was on the 8th floor.

On the sixth floor, there was an old door with a chain on it. It was dark. I couldn't see. My Room is right next to the door.

The room is for three because there are three beds. But I live alone. The first thing I felt when I came in was cold, because there was no heat in the north and it was still very cold. It has only one air conditioning. But during SARS, the air conditioning was not allowed to be used, and this time there was news that the quarantined hotel should be closed, so I was so scared the first night that I didn't even dare to turn on the air conditioning. But at 3:00 in the morning, even with all my clothes, down jacket and two quilts, I couldn't stand the cold and my teeth chattered.

Air-conditioning switch and air outlet

I'm torn. Should I turn on the air conditioner or not? I was scared, but in the middle of the night, my friend was asleep, and I was afraid to tell my mom, because I thought she'd be worried. I turn on my cell phone recorder, and I talk to myself for courage.

Later, I thought, if this live frozen fever, temperature problems, it is not worth it, so I turned on the air conditioning. Open the air-conditioning moment, I really seem to appear in front of a virus gushing out, flying in the air like. I slept in a mask that night, from about 4:00 a.m. to 8:00 a.m.

On the first day of the formal quarantine, I was woken up by a phone call at 8 am because we had taken our temperature by telephone, and I answered the phone in a daze, taking her temperature and telling her it was normal.

That morning, I decided to reflect. The person in charge said that the air conditioning is fine, here's the isolation condition is the expert has examined. But I was a little worried, because I called the front desk, and he said it was hierarchical control, and then he said it was room to room control, and the wobbly answer was disturbing. I've always been a bit skeptical about this, so I wear a mask even when I'm in a room with air conditioning on.

The first day was basically spent making phone calls and searching the Internet for information.

The Three Meals a Day are always at the door on time. Breakfast is generally congee or some dry food, lunch is from the restaurant ordered lunch. The caterer knocks on the door and calls out the room number, which I think is to make sure the person inside is awake.

I was afraid to open the door, and I was afraid to go out. Even though they disinfected me every day, I didn't dare. I even said I would have to spray alcohol on the porch after I opened the door. That's why I never see anyone else. It wasn't until yesterday that I saw my first delivery man.

My classmate joked, why do I feel like I'm in jail? But when I'm at peace with myself, I feel fine.

During the day, my mom brought me an electric blanket. After that, I didn't have to sleep with the air conditioning on or wear a mask. So I slept well the next night. Yesterday, the whole person's mentality is more relaxed, not so afraid. And my mom was talking to me, and she was like, "well, you're here now, and you can't leave, and you just have to believe it, because you can't help it if you don't believe it, and you can't help it if you're scared of yourself, because it makes you nervous. ". If the associated body also has some reaction, not good. "

The next day, that is to chat with students, look at e-books and so on. I've been in a small space for so long, my legs are a little numb, my joints are stiff, so I did some stretching yesterday to give myself something to do. Have a normal lunch.

The interior of the room

My mother sent me some more fruit this afternoon. At first my mom was so worried, she couldn't eat or sleep. But like she said, when you're here, you're here. I think she's a little better these days. But he kept trying to send me things, and he kept asking me, "are you gonna eat this or not? " "are you going to eat that? "In fact, in the small room exercise is very small, can not eat much every day, but I can feel her very afraid of what I want to use no, want to eat no. Afraid I'd be wronged.

The rest is mainly to pass the time. Every morning after I take my temperature, I ventilate the room, boil a big pot of hot water, and start a big wave of disinfection. Thought the time went by pretty fast. And a few good friends also give me a lot of help, they pull a group, chat with me, play play the script to kill the time of the game. They say you're scared to be alone, so talk to them. I think it helped a lot. At home, too, we all video eat together at meals.

According to the Neighborhood Committee and the person in charge, because there is a 14-day incubation period, I started from home to calculate 14 days to observe. It's been 12 days since I've been home. Two more days of isolation, nothing unusual, and I should be able to go home.

Looking at the whole thing now, I went from being shocked and upset when I got the news to actually being at Peace Now. At first, I felt that the conditions were not perfect, procedures are not complete, for example, notice is only the phone, I did not see any written materials. Later on, I think it's quite a lot of work for them to round up these people all over the city, but that's all right.

But my biggest concern is the quarantine of asymptomatic people. Is it really necessary to congregate in hotels? Personally, I'm scared. I think it might increase the risk of infection.

Now feel or choose to believe, because you always go to reflect, is also increasing the amount of work they are now enough. Maybe it's just barely holding together now, and when you do, they don't respond specifically, but they can get busy and make mistakes.

Jason, the scientist

Currently in self-isolation in Kunming, Yunnan Province

Our family of three go out to travel every Spring Festival, and this year is no exception. Last December, we booked a trip, ready to start on January 20, with the group to travel to Yunnan.

Around New Year's Day, I, like many people, saw a rumor on the Internet about some kind of pneumonia. Due to the industry, I pay more attention to this rumor.

During that time, weren't eight of the people who posted the message interviewed? One of the doctors worked in the same hospital as a friend of mine. At that time, those doctor friends, although afraid to say on the Internet, would try their best to send subtle messages through the circle of friends, such as people must wear masks. The current situation is not easy.

After seeing these news, I bought some masks at the first time, and wore them strictly with my family, dare not relax.

But at the same time, I didn't fully understand what he meant by "not easy. ". After all, my major wasn't medicine, and I couldn't get first-hand data. As I understood it at the time, the epidemic was now just a small fire in a fire that could be put out if the "Top" took it seriously enough.

It was this optimistic assessment, coupled with what was officially considered "manageable" at the time, that kept me from canceling my family's travel plans.

On January 20, we set off from Wuhan to Kunming. Throughout the trip, when we finally arrived at the hotel, my family and I wore masks and never took them off.

Over the next few days, the news came pouring in from all sides, and the situation changed far beyond my imagination. Something tells me we might not make it home.

â–  A night tour of the Xishuangbanna Botanical Garden

Sure enough, in the early hours of January 23, when I got up to go to the toilet in Xishuangbanna, I received the news that Wuhan was closed to the city. And even though I was ready for it, at that moment, I was in shock. So, what's next? How are the kids GonNa get to school? How are we supposed to work? What is this country going to face?

From that day on, everyone really realized the seriousness of the problem. At the same time, our situation in a foreign land became more delicate.

On the morning of the 23rd, the first signal occurred when we boarded the tour bus. After a routine briefing on the day's itinerary and DOS and don'ts, the guide broke the news that our family and another family's flight had been canceled. Then she asked us where we had started. I answered truthfully, "We started from Wuhan. ".

At that moment, I distinctly heard a gasp coming from the back row. I can imagine that my fellow passengers must be very upset at this moment, thinking how they were so unlucky to run into a group of Wuhan People.

When I got off the bus at the scenic spot, I noticed a marked increase in the number of people wearing masks in the tour group. Until now, only a handful of US had worn masks.

By the way, it is necessary to point out that the other member of the tour group whose flight was cancelled did not depart from Wuhan. They set out from Jiangsu and were "locked" only because of their native place in Wuhan.

Then, on January 24, we returned to Kunming from Xishuangbanna, where we were allowed to stay.

On January 25th, things got worse. From that day on, the hotel took our family's temperature every once in a while, and took photos of our identity papers, saying they were needed by the local police. Our Room was also shunned by the hotel staff.

On January 26, I went to the breakfast buffet in the hotel restaurant at 7:30 am and everything was normal. My wife and son didn't get up for breakfast until about 9:00, but they were back soon. As it turned out, they had just arrived at the restaurant door, reported the room number, was like the enemy to stop. The waiter suggested that they would bring breakfast to our room and let us eat by ourselves.

At that time, my son felt very aggrieved, for him, such a thing is really difficult to understand. I had to coax him to say, "the hotel room service is to charge a service charge, they give us free food, this is to improve our service AH! "! "

But my son was still upset, so I took two rolls of paper out of the bathroom and teased him and said, "well, they won't let us go to the restaurant, so we'll take all their rolls! "! "then he smiled through his tears.

Of course, I didn't just do it to make my son happy. I can see that if this goes on, supplies are bound to be tight, and these two rolls of paper might come in Handy.

My son's grievances are not without cause. Just the other day, after we admitted on the bus that we were from Wuhan, a little friend he had just met almost stopped playing with him.

But the good news is, kids communicate better with each other. At that time, my son explained plausibly to his friend, "I don't have a coronavirus! "! Not Everyone in Wuhan has a coronavirus! " The boy was soon persuaded and said, "well, then I believe you! "Then the two children put on masks and played happily together again.

Then one day, the kid came back to us. He said to me, "My mother said to ask you, do you have any fever now? "? My mom says that's what they ask at work.".

I noticed that his mother had a very embarrassed look on her face. Obviously, she had anxiety in her heart and was too embarrassed to ask, so she let the child test it out.

So, I told the kid, "don't worry, we've all taken our temperature, we're fine, and your mother can rest assured. ".

That day, the tour group in Kunming originally left a local travel program, but they still let us two Wuhan families signed the "voluntary withdrawal" agreement.

The day before checking out of the hotel, we had booked a local bed and breakfast in Kunming. As the owner of the hostel was also from Hubei Province, out of consideration for his fellow residents, they agreed to let us stay there after learning about our family situation and the strict protection they had experienced since the beginning of January.

But then, we received the news, according to Yunnan Tourism Management Higher Unit requirements, all the residential accommodation are not free to receive tourists in Wuhan. We didn't want to trouble the bed-and-breakfast owner, so we canceled our reservation.

At the time, I learned that the solution for us Hubei tourists in Yunnan Province was to ask each city / Autonomous Prefecture to designate one or two hotels to accommodate Hubei tourists.

To be honest, I'm not comfortable with this. Leaving aside the psychological "discrimination" factor, I can foresee that when so many of US foreign tourists are quarantined in one or two hotels, there will be trouble if supplies go wrong and the risk of cross-infection will increase.

Luckily, by this time, I had made contact with an old local friend and moved with his family into his new, empty house, where he still lives today.

These days, except for two times when I went out to buy supplies, my family hardly ever goes out. Even taking out the garbage, we can only go out when it is dark and windy at night, for fear of being caught by our neighbors, so that they will hear that people from Wuhan live in the building, it's making people nervous.

A friend of mine who lives in self imposed isolation in Shanghai is even more miserable than we are. He doesn't even dare to throw away garbage because the local government has already implemented garbage sorting. He is not skilled at it. If he makes a mistake, his neighbors will find out that he is a stranger and cause trouble.

I remember once, when I was out shopping for supplies, I took a taxi and when the driver talked, he asked me where I was from. In order to avoid trouble, I said he is Henan, but the driver or shocked, "you Henan are infected so much, also ran out wow! "! "

Although depressed, but fortunately, from January 20, our family has left Wuhan for 12 days, will soon exceed the so-called "incubation period" days. After that, maybe it won't be so hard.

Jiang Jiang, from Wuhan

Day 10 of quarantine in Zhuhai

Today is February 1, we are January 22 from Wuhan to Zhuhai.

For the Spring Festival holiday, my friends and I made a trip in late October. The original plan was to arrive in Zhuhai on January 22, arrive in Macau from Zhuhai on January 24, and then fly to Manila to begin our Spring Festival trip.

But on January 21, I saw on the news that because of the epidemic here, we were not encouraged to come to Wuhan, and I was a little shocked. I realized that things might be a bit serious. So I called the mayor's hotline to see if I could travel in this situation, and the staff said they had no right to restrict our personal freedom.

Since we have been receiving information that the disease is under control, considering that the epidemic should still be under control, we waited until the next day and set out as originally planned, from Wuhan to South Guangzhou, then south from Guangzhou to Zhuhai.

The next day in Zhuhai, on January 23rd, I woke up and clicked on my micro blog, as if the city of Wuhan was closed! I immediately realized the seriousness of the situation and discussed it with my partner. We were afraid that going out would cause trouble to others, so we decided to cancel the rest of the trip.

After I returned my trip, I booked a train ticket for the return journey on the 24th, because at that time it was no longer possible to buy a ticket directly at Wuhan station. After talking to the railway staff on the phone about the situation, we bought tickets to the next station in Wuhan, Xinyang.

Because originally just for the convenience of going to Macao, the hotel we stayed in was relatively simple, after staying for a day, considering that soon it will be the new year, we changed to a better hotel.

â–  Tips from the hotel's front desk

When we arrived at the new hotel, the little sister at the front desk saw the Chinese character for Wuhan on our ID card and stopped, telling us, "the system is broken. We need to wait a moment. ". After a while, their manager came over and said they didn't mean anything by it, but wanted us to go to the hospital for a physical and check in with a clean bill of health.

We also understood at the time, after all, so big thing, we are from Wuhan, the hotel cautious some is normal, so we took a taxi to the hospital.

After stating the purpose of our visit, we were instructed by the staff of the guiding table to hang up the number of internal medicine department.

When we got to the exam room, the doctor asked us, "what's wrong? "

We said, "we're not sick. Since we are from Wuhan and are staying in a hotel, they want us to open a health certificate. "

After hearing this, the doctor suddenly exploded and said, "who let you up here? "? Who told you to come to us? I can't prove it here! Even if I could prove that you're normal now, I can't prove that you'll be normal later. How am I supposed to drive this thing? You go to whoever sent you! "

In the face of such a series of criticism, we are at a loss. In the heart and persuade themselves, may be so, you have no way to criticize others, because others did not wrong.

So we went to the first floor guidance desk miss, she called the superior for nearly 20 minutes, and then let us go to the emergency call.

When I got to the emergency room, I noticed that the doctors and nurses here were heavily armed. We were received by a male nurse, and after we explained our business, he comforted us by saying, "don't be nervous. But we could tell he was more nervous than we were.

We were assigned to an emergency room doctor, and we explained that we had no fever or cough, but hoped to get a checkup and a health certificate to check into the hotel.

He said, "What hospital do normal people come to? You're a normal person. How can I certify you? Normal people don't need to come to the hospital. "

And they said, "well, can we get a blood test or something? "? "

The doctor replied, "since you asked for a blood test, I'll make you a list. ". "

After the check-up, all of our indicators are normal, we took it to the hotel's front desk lady to see, she replied that we can check in.

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
â–  The health notice given to ginger by the street

On the night of our successful arrival, we found that the route of the train we had booked had been cancelled in Wuhan Railway Station, and the customer service phone was still disconnected, so we had to return our tickets for unknown reasons. Since we couldn't leave Zhuhai for a short time, we wore masks the next day and went to the police station to make a record of the floating population.

At the police station, the policeman heard that we were from Wuhan, said "just a moment" to us, turned away, and soon his colleagues around also left. They're in the back room saying, "come on! Come on! There are two from Wuhan! "When I reappeared a few seconds later, I noticed that they were all wearing masks.

He said, "We don't run your district. "

I said, "where should we go? "

Then he said, "well, you're here now, so I'll check you in. ". "

At this point, the little sister at the front desk of the hotel sent us a message on wechat saying, "sorry, we have no way to let you stay here. ". Because the street side down the notice, not allow Wuhan people to live. "

The coldness and treatment I received over the last two days broke out in a collective explosion when I saw this message on Wechat -- I literally exploded -- as if "what more can we do? "? And now the hotel won't let us stay there. "

The COP across the street blurted out, "this is not our jurisdiction, this is not our jurisdiction, this is between you and the hotel, you negotiate with the hotel. ". "

Desperate, I called the mayor of Zhuhai hotline and explained the situation.

I don't know what we did wrong? Before coming out on the 22nd, I called the mayor's hotline of Wuhan to confirm; on the 23rd, when the city of Wuhan was closed, I immediately withdrew my follow-up itinerary and tried to buy a ticket home; the hotel asked us to open a health certificate, and we immediately went to the hospital for examination; Know temporarily can not return to Wuhan, take the initiative to the police station to do registration. We've been trying to convince ourselves that we're putting up with other people's attitudes, that they're doing the right thing, that we're really getting them in trouble, and that I'm afraid that if something happens to me, it's going to hurt them.

The operator of the mayor's hotline said, let's wait a minute, they'll take care of this as soon as possible.

So we went back to the hotel, followed the advice of the front desk, and shut ourselves in. Then in the afternoon, the street director called US and said, "I'm very sorry about this morning. Maybe there were some problems with communication and some misunderstanding. ". How about this? You'll be isolated in the hotel for 14 days, during which time you can order takeout, which will be delivered to your door. "

We did what he said.

The next morning, we have a lot of people at the door, the director of the street and his colleagues came to see us, also carrying a bag of chocolate and two red packets.

We said no because we thought we were already causing too much trouble.

He insisted that we take it, saying, "it's a bit of government concern. "

I saw the guy next to him pick up the camera, and I said, "what do you mean? "

He said, "No offense, just a tap, a note. ". "

Actually, we all do. But at that time, I really do not want to be in such a mess of their own in the lens of others. After I made it clear that I didn't want to be photographed, the staff member put the camera away.

â–  bring ginger some comfort in the "Peggy" bowl during isolation

In fact, we stay in the hotel these days, really thank the hotel manager, he came to US delivery, always love us, said "normal people are so shut bad. ". "

These days I have been scouring the Internet for news. To tell the truth, the treatment we received was much better than that of many other Wuhan compatriots outside, except for a slight misunderstanding in the early days, the staff of the hotel and the street really gave us a lot of care. And we're very sorry that we caused them so much trouble.

At the moment, we are taking our temperature and reporting it every day, and we are very thankful that we have been in good health so far. Therefore, I am now planning to buy a ticket back to Wuhan on the morning of February 7th after the quarantine period is over. I will pack and express my luggage in advance, and then if the train can stop at Wuhan, I will ride mobike home from Wuhan.

â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”

In fact, you should also be able to hear from the voice, in such an emergency period, in the face of such an emergency measures of isolation, the three narrators show a very understanding and cooperative attitude.

We should be grateful for the sacrifices they have made for the people of this country in terms of personal freedom, and I hope the public will not treat them with prejudice, because we are fighting an epidemic, not people from a particular region.

And people have sacrificed so much, the departments around the implementation of quarantine measures, but also with respect, more careful arrangement of their living needs.

Thank you for listening and wish you and your family good health!

- cover image source, Chinanews.com

Unidentified source picture provided by narrator
